body.p:
Hopkinsville Kentucky
Augt 21st 1863
His Excellency
James F Robinson
Dear Sir

I am well acquainted with the Petitioner Mistress Sarah Ann Myres and am satisfied she never kept liquor for sale -- I heard the testamony of the witnesses in Court and their manner of testimony satisfied me they were governed by a malicious motive in bringing the affair into Court, there seemed not to be a good feeling on the part of the Witness towards Mistress Myres, -- I want all Just fines (then War times) collected but I am so littled Satisfied of the unjustness of this one that I would humbly ask for executive clemency
